column1: America’s restaurants employ ~15 million hard-working people have been disproportionately impacted by covid and most are barely hanging-on. I’m working w/members of Congress on both sides of the aisle to find common ground and deliver aid to ALL in need. https://t.co/3mlZjan87w
Desperately sick people being intubated saying “I didn’t know COVID was real and I wish I had worn a mask”.   Political misinformation has very human consequences. https://t.co/5Hqsnd7QBI

The confluence of wintery weather moving us indoors covid fatigue no national testing and tracing system and growing case and death counts means we must unite in Minnesota and throughout the country to protect one another’s health and help America get on the road to recovery. https://t.co/MSKUCIvJgo

Decency and bipartisanship are still alive in Congress.  ⁦@RepDustyJohnson⁩ and I co-led 48 colleagues on the ⁦@ProbSolveCaucus⁩ in developing a comprehensive bipartisan covid relief framework that can break the impasse. And it may just work. https://t.co/BZ7Dx4U5Nz

I’m a Gold Star son.  The president who hosts indoor gatherings criticizes mask wearing and social distancing dismisses his @CDC’s guidelines and puts others at risk is now blaming Gold Star families for infecting him?  Any wonder why America leads the world in covid deaths? https://t.co/YAHp2qxDgp

After co-leading the @ProbSolveCaucus group that developed the March to Common Ground bipartisan covid relief framework @RepDustyJohnson and I sat down with @ASP to discuss proxy voting in Congress. We invite all Americans to debate issues with the same vigor AND respect. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/6mR7IB3ScI

With much of the @WhiteHouse senior staff quarantined w/COVID and @realDonaldTrump’s diagnosis pharmaceutical regimen and contradictory tweets this afternoon it begs the question who’s looking out for the President - and all of us. The @VP should issue a statement immediately.

6. Provides $150b for Coronavirus Relief Fund for state local and tribal governments. 7. Provides $10b for SBA emergency grants of up to $10000 for small businesses. 8. Provides $17b for SBA to cover 6 mos of payments for businesses with existing loans. 4/7

THREAD: While the $2T #coronavirus relief bill may still change before the Senate vote negotiations have considerably enhanced support for our most vulnerable our most impacted our healthcare system our small businesses & our entire nation. Here's a list of improvements: 1/7

The coronavirus relief bill shouldn’t be a vehicle for anything unrelated to mitigating the direct effects of the epidemic. Nor should it be a vehicle for a $500 billion discretionary fund without controls oversight and accountability. Do you agree?
We need a C.O.P. (Congressional Oversight Panel) on the COVID-19 spending beat.👇🏻 https://t.co/EgyTikOQJf https://t.co/aSvAkpND72

You raised your hands so I just introduced a bill to establish a COVID-19 Oversight Panel to ensure loans and grants to businesses states and cities are transparent and subject to Congressional oversight. Time is of the essence so lets. get. this. done. https://t.co/EgyTikOQJf https://t.co/HUxxOTAe4K

Here’s the Senate GOP’s “Phase III” coronavirus relief package. Please help me by sharing your comments about what’s good as is what requires modification what should be eliminated and what needs to be added:  https://t.co/kmMRpjB4xz

I’m close w/people in MN IL UT FL & NY who’ve already tested positive for COVID-19. It’s already everywhere and the coming days will determine our fate - for better or for worse. It’s up to every individual American to take action now. If you can stay home. PLEASE stay home.

Dr. Kelly Searle a @UMNews infectious disease epidemiologist shared some information about how #COVID19 is transmitted between individuals mail and surfaces. If you missed our coronavirus briefing stream here and do your part to #FlattenTheCurve: https://t.co/eIkwACMiXM https://t.co/C6TYSqQiny

According to @tomfriedman: 1) @potus should be on the phone w/Xi Jinping everyday 2) lift tariffs immediately and unburden supply chain 3) convene working group of the G-20 & begin collaborating asap  4) if US doesn’t lead now it’s going to be a China-led world AC (after corona)

On our coronavirus briefing call Lisa Shannon of @AllinaHealth said simply "We need your help." Minnesota's healthcare frontliners are asking us to #FlattenTheCurve by practicing social distancing. We can do so and still take care of one another: https://t.co/eIkwACMiXM https://t.co/RbvxUPprzs

The Defense Production Act just implemented by @potus: 1) facilitates production of items necessary to support the mitigation and treatment of COVID-19 2) provides for price and wage stabilization and the settlement of labor disputes 3) strengthens controls over credit

Many have asked me about the status of the Phase II coronavirus measures we passed in the House last Saturday am. The Senate is now debating the bill and hopefully will pass it shortly. Phase III action being discussed now and will be formally considered soon. More to come. https://t.co/Ij6bsbWrni

If you missed our coronavirus briefing call last night the full conversation is available here. @SenTinaSmith Dr. Rob Thomas of EPPA Lisa Shannon of @AllinaHealth Dr. Kelly Searle of @UMNews and I shared lots of information and a little optimsism too: https://t.co/eIkwACMiXM https://t.co/gUQERvzlGH

Heartfelt gratitude to my co-host @SenTinaSmith Dr. Rob Thomas of EPPA Lisa Shannon of @AllinaHealth Dr. Kelly Searle of @UMNews + 1000s of Minnesotans for joining our coronavirus briefing call. We shared info answered q’s and feel blessed to represent our remarkable state.

Lisa Shannon @AllinaHealth COO:  "We have to slow the spread because we don't want patients to transmit this illness and we need to make sure clinicians are available to take care of people with heart disease cancer and coronavirus."

Dr. Kelly Searle @UMNews epidemiologist:  "You should cancel your travel plans. COVID-19 can travel quickly and efficiently through people. Whether you feel healthy or not when we decrease our network and immediate contacts we are decreasing who we can spread to."

Dr. Rob Thomas Emergency Physician:   "Common symptoms for coronavirus might feel early on like the common cold. It starts with a sore throat sometimes a fever and deeper into the illness a shortness of breath can develop."

Dr. Kelly Searle @UMNews epidemiologist:  "#COVID19 has shown to be incredibly transmissible. The curve is growing. When we talk about physical and social distancing we are talking about breaking the chain of transimissions to reduce the number of cases in our community." https://t.co/KF8rgazXH4

Happening now:   @SenTinaSmith and I are teaming up with Minnesota health experts to answer your questions about COVID-19. Join our coronavirus briefing call. ⬇️  Dial in: 855-927-0897  Stream live: https://t.co/quq8crfUCU https://t.co/NrPv98kAJb
Optimism and action are just as contagious as coronavirus.

During challenging times Minnesotans band together.   @SenTinaSmith and I are teaming up to get you the answers you need about COVID-19. Dial in to our coronavirus briefing call on Monday at 6PM and submit your questions now.   Here's how:  https://t.co/2gQyvJpd4S

Have questions about the Families First Coronavirus Response Act or COVID-19? Join me @SenTinaSmith and MN public health experts on a free coronavirus briefing call Monday at 6PM: 855-927-0897  Submit your Q's now we'll get to as many as possible: https://t.co/2gQyvJpd4S https://t.co/GuPfafk8z6 https://t.co/fofPko1B6g

We all have a role to play in keeping our communities healthy - and I know you may have questions. @SenTinaSmith and I invite you to join a free and open-to-the-public coronavirus briefing call with Minnesota public health experts on Monday.  Details: https://t.co/JyWdEDEqfV https://t.co/IV3zR0nzr4 https://t.co/7r8GYoLOx8

Health care leaders and epidemiologists are telling me that containment of COVID-19 is likely impossible now - leaving mitigation and treatment as our priorities. “Flattening the curve” will help hospitals meet demand and slow down and reduce the size of the epidemic. 1/3

We're in this together #MN03. Wash your hands and stay home if you are sick. If you have questions an #MN03 Coronavirus Information Center is live at: https://t.co/WO4NLwclrU https://t.co/foYVlAlF5Q https://t.co/2vNgBQ4xcg
And if you need assistance with a federal agency related to #coronavirus (or anything else) my team is here to help: https://t.co/HPPBMZOURI https://t.co/VrVvR98531
For up-to-date information about #coronavirus consult @CDCgov and the Minnesota Department of Public Health.  https://t.co/txSZEhbqxE

I am monitoring the developing #coronavirus situation closely and remain committed to tackling this threat with a unified nonpartisan front. ICYMI here's more about the meeting and I had with the @VP this week:  [@WhiteHouse Photo by D. Myles Cullen] https://t.co/9wWWJ7IHnh https://t.co/UwUl1iVIer

Today’s announcement of a #coronavirus (COVID-19) case in Minnesota is cause for concern but not cause for panic.  We all have a role to play in keeping our community healthy. If you or a loved one are exhibiting symptoms call the MN Dpt of Health #COVID19 Hotline: 651-201-3920 https://t.co/2vfZyScX2U

As we prepare for the likely emergence of #coronavirus / #covid19 cases in our region know that Minnesota is home to some of the very best healthcare systems and professionals in the entire world. A special shout-out to @mnnurses who are on the frontlines each and every day. 🙌🏻 https://t.co/tj47gYtB7f

THREAD: I was among a small group of @ProbSolveCaucus members who met with @VP Pence and Dr. Deborah Birx at the @WhiteHouse today for an update on #coronavirus/  #covid19 and to ask critical questions about our federal strategy and resource needs. (1/4)

Thank you to @SecPompeo for appearing before the @HouseForeign Affairs Committee today. We must tackle the emerging COVID-19 pandemic with a united front at home and overseas and ensure that our public health officials are afforded the resources to do so effectively. https://t.co/pESSkTeVjV

Good news today about negative #coronavirus cases in MN. #MSP airport is a busy international hub and thousands of Minnesota businesses rely on air travel. It's important to be prepared and vigilant so I asked the CDC and FAA to brief our delegation on their contingency plans. https://t.co/CVClwwsgrS https://t.co/j0yIIh42Qw
